problem_text: Can the free Burnside group B(m, n), for any m and n = 2l ≫ 1, be given by defining relations of the form v^n = 1 such that for any natural divisor d of n distinct from n the element v^d is not trivial in B(m, n)? S. V. Ivanov
answer: Yes, it can (S. V. Ivanov, Int. J. Algebra Comput., 4, no. 1–2 (1994), 1–308).
